analysis.Summary: Vue page component that renders a list of payments. It displays a header with filterable tabs and an action button to create a new payment, and then loads and shows payment items in a feed layout.
analysis.Purpose: Provide a user interface to view, filter, and navigate through wallet payments in the application.

Components.name: SectionPageTitle
Components.responsibility: Renders the page title, tab navigation, and action buttons; emits events when the current tab changes.

Components.name: Feed
Components.responsibility: Generic data‐loading feed component that handles fetching, pagination, empty states, search, and renders items via slots.

Functions.name: payments.actions.read
Functions.description: Fetches a page of payment records from the store or API.

parameters.options: Object containing fetch parameters (limit, owner ID, type filter, etc.)

Functions.returns: Promise resolving to a list of payment items.

Functions.name: updateTab
Functions.description: Inline handler for SectionPageTitle's update:tabs_current event; updates the reactive `tab` value.

analysis.Usage: Registered as a route view in the wallet module. Other parts of the router or parent layouts import this component by its file path (`modules/wallet/views/components/pages/Payments.vue`) to render the payments page.
Notes: Uses SCSS styles scoped to generic utility classes (`.round-stat`, `.order-card`) though some of these classes are not referenced in the template and may be shared or leftover.
The `tab` reactive variable controls filtering by payment status; when set to anything other than 'all', an extra `type` option is passed to the feed store read function.

The Feed component relies on a v-slot to expose `items` and uses a simple `v-for` block to render raw payment objects; in a production build, a dedicated PaymentCard sub‐component might replace the placeholder `{{ payment }}`.
The route parameter `route.params._id` is used as `owner` to scope payments to a specific user or entity.
